text:
Hey Chris,
As per your instruction I have removed my free and paid theme from the approval queue. And now I am unable to upload my theme for the review. My both theme shows me error "This theme is already listed". However, I already removed it from the approval queue. Please help me asap.
Hi Ankit, thank you for reaching out. I will reach out to you directly to resolve the issue.
Hi <@UEYNCDE2Y> it looks like you were able to submit your theme. Can you confirm whether you’re still running into the issue or not?
<@UPDDTPW3H> We're having the same issue. Can you please share how you solved it?
Ditto :confused:
Hi @channel Tejas said that you can help me with the theme submit. He thinks that is a caching issue.

<@U01C6BC4TJT>
• put the relative path for module code in .html files 
• must be important
 to change the module icons
Thanks <@UPDDTPW3H>! Do you know if the module icons each need unique images?
Hey Melanie :wave:  yes each theme module must have a unique icon per this requirement (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/marketplace-requirements/theme-requirements#theme-modules>).

Hey All,
I’m running into a submission error for
```The theme shouldn't depend on external assets. External CODED_FILES: /Coded files/Custom/page/Figmints_Theme/Fig-module-checklist.js```
Where should I look for external dependancies?
Thanks for the quick response!

Hey Tyler I believe this is in reference to using absolute paths vs. relative paths. For files within your theme please use relative paths (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/marketplace-requirements/theme-requirements#assets-must-use-a-local-file-path>)
Hey! Have you had any luck figuring this out?
Hey Jason, thanks for the quick response.  However this error is talking about external css and js files.  but I don’t have references to them anywhere within my theme’s code
Not yet Melanie :disappointed:
Hmm.. do you mind sending me over a link in a direct message with where the error is being shown?
sure can
I'm in contact with AJ LaPorte to solve this, you are having the same problem? Tejas think it is a caching problem
Hi Chiara, can you try resubmitting? It looks like the issue may be resolved. Please DM me if you’re still running into issues
Can you please send me a DM with your Hub ID and the name of your theme?
Yup, having the same problem. The only validation error is my Theme, same as your screenshot
Nicolas, please DM me with your Hub ID and your theme name. I can take a look
<@U01C6BC4TJT> I was able to fix it by removing one dot from theme.json of the theme, the path was incorrect, but not sure if that is happening with your theme, check it
Hey.. we are getting this error in this portal 358710
Looks like this <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YGWHDKQ/p1606166456141400>
<@U26AKMZ19>, can you take a look at this?
Digging in now
Thanks <@UNQ6UDGSJ> :slightly_smiling_face:
What is the process in updating a module or template with a bug?
Did you receive feedback from the QA team?
…or did you discover a bug beforehand so your theme is still in ‘pending approval’ state?

Hi Everyone! The q&a team gave me two things to adjust for my submitted theme. They were really simple edits, and they are complete in the master files. How do I ‘re-submit’, or is that process simply letting the q&a team know that those things are done?

Hi Sam, you can go back to your marketplace listings and your theme should be set to ‘unapproved’. If you select the theme you’ll see an option to ‘edit listing’. Simply go through the steps and it will resubmit for approval
bug in module. already in the wild

Gotcha. You can go to your listings manager, and there will be an option to ‘edit listing’. It will walk you through the same listing flow and it will be resubmitted for approval.
Your current listing will remain published until the update is approved.
Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you’re having issues resubmitting

Hi Chris! Thanks for the speedy response. I know you are all buried over there. I followed those steps, and the submit for approval button is grayed out saying the theme is being validated. Will this take a certain amount of time?
<https://www.dropbox.com/s/14c0xs2srtqbm03/Screen%20Shot%202020-11-23%20at%205.26.09%20PM.png?dl=0>
or do I not have to hit that submit button again?
It normally takes up to 30 seconds or so. Try giving the page a refresh
re-submitted!
i did refresh, but apparently just needed to wait longer
one other super quick question
Sure thing!

I submitted this quite a few weeks ago, as I am sure you are aware of the backlog that your team is working through. The two edits were incredibly minor, and did not really affect anything. More cleanup. Am I going to have to wait for another super long period of weeks before its actually approved or will those two edits get looked at and then it will be approved

We are working extremely hard to turn theme reviews around as quickly as possible. I’m not sure if you attended the last AMA, but we have an additional group of HubSpotters who are helping with reviews, so things should be turned around much faster.
One note, is that the US offices (which the majority of our QA team is part of) are on holiday Wed-Fri of this week so we will not be reviewing during that time.
However, next week we are dedicating a number of resources to the project so there will be a lot of action!
thanks! The sooner the better :smile:
And thanks for the help getting it resubmitted in a timely manner!

<@UNQ6UDGSJ> for me its 1am for me and <@U01FKB4HCTW> is still debugging andHS issue. Is it ok that <@U01FKB4HCTW> finished the submissions ( will give him the text, etc) but I make an update/polish tomorrow?

The other option would be I simply file for divorce :wink:
<@U27V4MTK9> - responding via dm

Hey everyone,

Our marketplace support team will be signing off for the evening very shortly.

If you run into any bugs or errors while trying to submit your theme to the asset marketplace this evening, don't panic. Take a screenshot of the issue and post it here. Then complete the contest entry form on <https://HubSpot.devpost.com/> before the deadline.

We will help you get your theme submitted to the marketplace tomorrow and you will still be included in the contest.

Just again, *make sure you submit the entry form on devpost before the deadline.* 

Thanks!
Issue is with cached references to scripts that were removed from settings.
Portal ID: 313824
see <@U26AKMZ19> for additional details

Hi there - We've submitted our entry form, but I need some help with the theme submission itself. The partner portal link isn't appearing on the developer dashboard and it just seems to redirect when I try to activate asset provider account again. Please DM me in the AM :slightly_smiling_face:
Hi All, we seem to be having the same issues others are experiencing - 2522354
Hello <@U22PWJ41G> , It was fixed itself after sometime :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello! Our theme for the theme challenge passed the initial validation but seems to be caught up in a similar issue as some other people's submission during the final step. We attempted to resolve the validation issues by following the links provided, but most of the modules were showing 0 errors within the design manager, so we were unsure what to do at that point. Hope that was at all helpful! Portal ID# 395201

Hello,

I’m trying to submit my theme and I’ve had several errors. I’m correcting it but nothing can fix it and I don’t want to unblock it. If you have a lead friends

Thank you very much
Hello! We keep running into this error as well this evening
Portal ID: 5095977
CC <@U018Y274877> and <@U01FDND7LH0> :slightly_smiling_face:
mike i have same problem
my portail id : 6119820
